description: A confidential message authored by Marek Halden emerges, urging for democracy and transparency, leaving citizens intrigued but cautious.
Discourse in Stenograd shifts as citizens are invited to new community forums to discuss democratic reform, boosting civic engagement.
A dormant satellite activates, broadcasting Halden's message promoting democracy and transparency, sparking widespread discussion.
The Council convenes to deliberate on the message's impact and the possibility of including public participation in governance to stabilize BCI.
Community workshops are organized citywide, encouraging citizens to engage collaboratively in decision-making and BCI stabilization efforts.
Preliminary reports indicate rising public optimism and minor improvements in BCI reliability through community-driven initiatives.
The Council begins drafting plans to reflect democratic ideals in governance, influenced by community feedback and Halden's legacy.
Owing to discussions in public forums, more citizens take active roles in suggesting reforms to ensure transparency and public involvement.
